alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 17 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York, including Clinton and Essex Counties. Also for central and northern Vermont. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms are expected Tuesday afternoon and evening. Due to saturated soils and the potential for 1 inch per hour rainfall rates, there will likely be a renewed threat for flash flooding in any stronger storms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Western Clinton; Western Essex
